page.title: 06TOFT HILL HALL FARM(CONT)
page.content: shoulder identification to distinguish them from those of neighbouring farms. The farm has 2 breeding bulls, a Hereford and a Charolais. The cows used to breed from were crossbred Friesan, Limousin and Aberdeen Angus. There were 35 suckler cows, 20 2-year-old cows, 44 1-year-old cows and 38 calves. It is the policy of the farm to sell the cattle when they are 2.5 years old. The cattle are grazed in the fields as long as the weather and grass growth permit. In the cold winter months the cattle are brought into shed accommodation where they are fed silage and hay and other commmercial feeds. The main machinery on the farm is of course associated with the production of the grass feed and consists of 4 tractors, a muck spreader, forage harvester, elevator,
